Name: Dickie Dick Dickens
Description:
One player playes Dickie Dick Dickens (DDD) and up to four players are his pursuers. DDD has to get from one D-Space to the other. Movement is determined by a die. The pursuers start at the blue V-spaces and try to catch DDD by landing on the space he occupies. If DDD lands on a space that is occupied by a pursuer, the pursuer goes to prison for the rest of the game. If a 6 is rolled the player may not move but draws a card and has to follow the instructions printed on it. DDD may not move through the blue areas, whereas the pursuers are forbidden to move through the orange areas.

DDD wins the game if he reaches the other D-space. The pursuers win if they manage to catch DDD.

The game was most likely published between 1957 and 1962, when the DDD radio show was aired.

Name: Jackwagon
Description:
Jackwagon A PARTY GAME FOR THE DERANGED  is a tabletop party game. Players take turns drawing cards from a card deck and perform challenges to earn Badonka Dollars (play money. But BEWARE of the Jacked Up cards! With a Jacked Up card, the player then draws a Jackwagon card and ANYTHING goes with a Jackwagon challenge! If a player draws a challenge card they are unwilling to perform, the player can make a Jack-Offer and offer the card to the other players by paying them or getting paid by them to perform the challenge. However, be strategic because the object of the game is to be the player with the most Badonka Dollars after 60 minutes.

Are you a fearless competitor? Are you willing to be more shameless than your friends? Prove it and win the title of Jackwagon!

—description from the designer

Name: Uncaged: World Fighters
Description:
Uncaged: World Fighters is a 2 player fighting card game designed to simulate the action of a mixed martial arts contest!

Players will select a fighter from our diverse, international roster of martial artists, each representing a unique fighting style. They can then use the decks out of the box or create their own; filled with punch, kick, takedown and submission cards all designed to reduce their opponent's HP to 0 and finish the fight!

Using their individual decks, players will string together huge combinations to either inflict massive damage or lay traps for their opponent. The winner is the last person standing, and every style has a chance to score a knockout.

—description from the publisher

Name: Card Assassins
Description:
Card assassins is not your average card game. It is played at all times behind the scenes.  It is the perfect game for group trips, competitive roommates, back stabbing co-workers or  courageous families.

How the game works

Assassinate assigned players by getting them to say their “kill word” during a normal conversation. Acquire their target and kill word and move on. Last one standing wins! Don't get assassinated!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Gallerist: Scoring Expansion
Description:
This expansion brings variability to the Intermediate Scoring that is otherwise the same every game.

When this phase begins, players may score none, some, or all of the 3 pre-determined tiles instead of the usual Intermediate Scoring. To score, players first need to fill the tiles' goals.

-description from publisher

Name: H.D.P. 4: Hasta Donde Puedas
Description: Expansion that adds more cards.

Name: H.D.P. 5: Hasta Donde Puedas
Description: Expansion that adds more cards.

Name: Cim
Description:
Cim is an abstract game for two to four players, played on a fifteen by fifteen rectangular grid. Each player attempts to arrange a set of Miwin's Dice (numbers III, IV, and V in the family) into the shape of an isosceles right triangle.

Placement of dice is constrained by their distance on the grid from other dice. During initial placement, dice are placed exactly n units away from the last die placed (which has n pips showing). Once all dice are on the board, a player may re-position one of her own dice with respect to the pips showing on any other die on the board.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sector 7
Description:
Sector 7 is a two-player, information based abstract strategy game with a random starting set-up. On the 4 orbits around a pink planet, both players place four/five ships, the goal of the game is to remove all of the opponent's ships.

Each player holds three cards. There are a further three cards face up in the center that each display possible movements. On a player's turn they can choose one of the cards from the center and: move one of their pieces on its orbit to the sector indicated by the chosen card, then replace the card with a card from their hand; move a moon along its orbit by the number of spaces indicated by the chosen card; or move one ship to an adjacent space. These actions may not be repeated until all possible action types have been completed.

Moving a ship onto one of the opponent's ships removes that ship from the game, as does hitting an opponent's ship with a moon. Players can regain a ship if they occupy a moon as it moves into sector 7. Removing all of the opponent's ships wins the game.

-description from publisher

Name: Truth Be Told: Girls' Night Out
Description:
A hybrid between Jenga and a party game geared toward women.

The game consists of a set of small wooden blocks. Each block has a personal question written on it, like "What is the biggest sacrifice you ever made for a boyfriend?" or "Have you ever taken revenge on an ex?" The blocks are used to form a Jenga-type tower.

Players take turn removing blocks. To stay in the game, a player must also answer the question on the block. The person is eliminated if the other players agree that the answer was not truthful. A player who makes the tower fall is eliminated. The tower is then rebuilt and the game continues as above.

The last player to remain in the game is the winner.

Name: Los Tres Reinos
Description:
Los Tres Reinos (AKA Ajetrez), is an innovative strategy game for three players, developed in Venezuela.

Actually, more than a game, it is a story of medieval fantasy, in which three kingdoms require solving the situation that is presented to them by having grown to the point that their populations have begun to mix. The Monarchs of these kingdoms come together to resolve this situation, leading them to make a strategy game that shows who is the right leader to lead these realms as one, this  story takes us to an exciting board game were will be revealed who is the most appropriate leader to rule the destiny of the resulting kingdom.

The desired thing is to reunite the families around a fun board game and develop their intellect.

The main objective of the game it´s to conquer the other 2 kingdoms, by strategy and negotiation keeping the balance among the powers, the winner it´s the player that captures the leaders of the other kingdoms.

This boardgame reimplements chess into a 3 players game,where the classic chess rules were modified to make a balanced 3 way game.

The game includes a circular grid board, 57 pieces among 3 kingdoms colors (red, white, Black) rules, storybook and scoring Sheets.

This game it´s intended for competitive scene with tournaments and leagues.

Name: Scrabble Speed
Description:
Scrabble Speed is the heart pounding, word making game everyone plays at the same time! The Tile Tower gives you just the right amount of letters to spell as many words as possible within one minute. After the electronic timer buzzes, easy scoring keeps the pace going as players put their tiles back into the dispenser, redraw 12 new tiles, and start fresh each round. The player with the highest score after 7 rounds wins the game! For 2-4 players. Ages 10+. Batteries not included.

Features:
- Race against other players in this quick-spell word game!
- Tile Tower tumbles out tiles!
- Quick! Everyone has one minute to build their words. The timer is counting down!
- Easy scoring keeps the pace going before the next round begins with a fresh set of tiles
- The player with the highest score after 7 rounds wins the game!

Name: Starlight Stage: Shining Star
Description:
Starlight Stage: Shining Star, an expansion for Starlight Stage, includes 13 idol cards, 14 fame cards, 27 event cards, and 6 initial idol cards. With this expansion, you can play Starlight Stage with five people and give your talent agency a wider pool of starlets to put under those bright lights!

—description from the publisher

Name: Legends of the Ancient World: Echoes of the Old Ones
Description:
Once, the Old Ones ruled the earth. Today, they are mostly forgotten, aside from a few die-hard cults and scattered passages in moldy tomes. But suddenly, there is a rise in the activities of those who remember... a ripple in reality...

Echoes of the Old Ones is a three-part adventure. Each part can be played in an evening, and may be played separately or as part of the whole mini-campaign.

Echoes of the Old Ones is a complete programmed fantasy adventure for solitaire or group play. This game includes the adventure booklet, game rules, playing pieces and game map. It is suitable for ages 12 and up and can be played with either the included Legends of the Ancient World game system by Dark City Games, or other hex-based tactical combat game systems such as Metagaming's Melee.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Legends of the Ancient World (Dark City Games)

Name: Superfight: The Walking Dead – Negan Mini-Deck
Description:
Welcome to pee pee pants city! This 18 card mini expansion for Superfight adds new cards from the Walking Dead comics, with a focus on Negan and his very special lady.

Included in The MegaBox subscription service.

—description from the publisher

Name: Foragers: Worker Placement Expansion
Description:
The Foragers: Worker-Placement Expansion pack infuses a worker-placement mechanic into the base game; on each turn, players now must choose from a limited number of common actions.  In the original game, players chose actions from their own action cards, making the majority of player interaction occur by pawn movement. The use of new common action cards therefore creates more player interaction.

The pack consists of 11 total cards.  
9 Rotating Action Cards
1 Turn Order Card
1 Reference Card

There will be no printed rules, but they will be provided in a PDF file.

Name: SSO: First Captain
Description:
A 31 card tuck box including 24 Challenge Cards, 6 Mission cards and 1 Achievement card. Allows players to face a new threat and tell a new story of survival horror on the SSO. 
The new deck's theme features the original mission's Captain stalking and picking off player's crew members in a deadly game of cat and mouse.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Global Series: Jiang Yanggu & Mu Yanling
Description:
These Global Series decks, featuring all-new cards and characters, represent the work of Chinese writers, artists, and designers, created for Chinese players but now available in the United States.

The box contains two ready-to-play decks of Magic: The Gathering.

Name: Uniwersytet Niepodległy
Description:
Board game about history of Catholic University of Lublin

Independent University is educational card-boardgame.
It was released by Fundacja Rozwoju KUL to commemorate the hundredth anniversary of the creation of the Catholic University of Lublin.
And also to celebrate the hundredth anniversary of regaining independence by Poland.
Players choose roles from seven available, and try to study, and graduate with best score.
The game is divided into five years, which are divided into trimesters.
They will met lots of events connected with history of University or Polish Independence.
First three years they learn about University, and last two years they can get to know the city of Lublin.

Components:
1 Rulebook
1 Board
1 dice 10 sided
7 magnetic players boards
32 magnetic counters
7 pawns
10 year cards
169 event cards (124 for University, 95 for City)
2 aid sheets
1 magnetic turn track

Name: Mr. Rhee: Surviving the Nightmare World
Description:
Mr. Rhee: Surviving the Nightmare World is a 3-6 player asymmetrical card game, where the one plays the hero and the many are the villains. As a Villain, spend Greed to recruit and send your evil minions to take control of locations throughout Nightmare World from the innocents -- or use your character specific win conditions to seize the day. As the Hero, use Hope to gather Fight, Charisma, and Magic to hold out for six rounds -- the day and night of the Three days of Darkness that are consuming Nightmare World -- using your team and abilities to mitigate damage... and set the Villains at each other’s' throats. Fast-paced and wickedly fun, this game plays in about 30 minutes. Will you take over the Nightmare World, or just survive it?

Gameplay
Gameplay starts with the hero determining which villain should play first. That Villain spends Greed to recruit Minions, and place them in Locations. Placement happens either secretly (face-down where they will do team damage), or with fangs bared (face-up where they may single out a specific victim among the Innocents, Heros, or opposing Villain’s Minions). However, Greed is flipped to Hope, so the more actions a Villain takes, the more the Hero will be able to counter. The Hero then uses Hope to move to locations, and gather Fight, Charisma, and Magic. Each Hero abilities card costs more Hope than the previous, so the Hero determine what skills are worth the cost.
Once the alternating sides of Villain and Hero have each taken their turn, any Locations with conflict are resolved. This time, the starting Villain may choose which Location resolves first. The Innocents fight the Minions with the help of the Heroes, who now use their skills of Fight (brute force against the opposing side) Charisma (persuading a Minion to turn on his allies) Magic (targeting a single Minion to attack) while the Villains strategically use their Minions abilities and brute strength.
When the conflict is concluded, so is the round, and the fight begins anew. Either the heroes use their skills and special powers to hold off the terror for all 6 rounds (Day and Night of “The Three Days of Darkness”), or one of the Villains meet their asymmetrical win conditions to take the city by force, rule the world, and win the game!

Theme
In the graphic novel series NIGHTMARE WORLD we learn that once upon a time an Archangel named Lucifer, incensed with what he saw as a tyrannical reign over all Creation by God, organized a revolt coup that he hoped would give him control of Earth and all humanity. It failed. As a result, Lucifer and the angels who followed him were banished to the bowels of the Earth as punishment, forever banned from Heaven and Earth. Realizing that the numbers were on his side, Lucifer has since spent years organizing a plan for revenge – this time relying not just on the Fallen Angels, but also recruiting Lilith and her countless demon spawn, Cthulhu and the Great Old Ones, rallying them together as part of one concentrated effort to occupy Earth and take control of Creation in a campaign of monstrous terror dubbed “The Three Days of Darkness.”
In the spin-off graphic novel series TALES OF MR. RHEE we learn that humanity is not without its defenses against the forces of darkness, both with the street-fighting magician Mr. Rhee as well as the covert cabal of magicians known as The P.R.O.M.I.S.E. Group. When “The Three Days of Darkness” erupt across the world, The P.R.O.M.I.S.E. Group, dedicated to the “Permanent Reduction Of Monsters in Society Everywhere”, emerge from the shadows to join forces with Mr. Rhee and a collection of other heroes who know they may not be able to win, but are nonetheless willing to sacrifice everything to make sure the forces of darkness won’t either.
Written by horror comic master Dirk Manning – who also serves as a consultant on this game – NIGHTMARE WORLD Volumes 1-4, the NIGHTMARE WORLD OMNIBUS, and TALES OF MR. RHEE Volumes 1-4 (so far) are all published by Devil’s Due Publishing and available anywhere comics are sold.

—description from publisher

Name: El Juego de Botilde
Description:
Game based on the traditional Game of the Goose. It was used in a giant size in 1983 in the Spanish most famous TV contest "Un, dos, tres... responda otra vez" (on which the British "Three, two, one" was based) and shortly after comerciallized as a board game for the general public.

For this game two different dices are used: One is the traditional dice from 1 to 6; and in the other there are four images of Botilde, one x2 and one negative sign. If it falls in Botilde the throw of the other dice remaines unchanged; while a x2 doubles that roll; and the - forces to go back instead of advance.

As in the Game of the Goose, falling into a Botilde means going "from boot to boot and shoot because it touches you". There are also question boxes; and trip boxes, which assignes a try-out. The other boxes all have a specific function, sometimes positive and sometimes negative, including those that make leaving the game. In the last section, called "the magic circle", the players would go around until they are eliminated or fall exactly in the Booty playing only with the traditional dice.
—user summary (translated)

Juego basado en la tradicional Oca. Se utilizó en un formato gigante en 1983 en el concurso de TV "Un, dos, tres... responda otra vez", para ser comercializado al poco tiempo como juego de mesa para el público general.

Para este juego se utilizaban dos dados diferentes: Uno era el dado tradicional del uno al seis; y en el otro había cuatro imágenes de Botilde, un x2 y un -, si caía en Botilde la tirada del otro dado quedaba sin cambios, mientras que un x2 doblaba esa tirada, y el - hacía retroceder en lugar de avanzar.  
Como en la oca, caer en una Botilde significaba ir "de bota a bota y chuta porque te toca". También había casillas de pregunta, y casillas de tropezón, que asignaban una prueba.

El resto de casillas tenían todas una función específica, unas veces positiva y otras negativas, incluyendo las que hacían abandonar el juego. En el último tramo, llamado "el círculo mágico", los jugadores irían dando vueltas hasta que fueran eliminados o cayeran exactamente en el botín jugando solamente con el dado tradicional.
—user summary

Name: La Carrera del Chollo
Description:
It was used in a giant size in 1984 in the Spanish most famous TV contest "Un, dos, tres... responda otra vez" (on which the British "Three, two, one" was based)and shortly later comerciallized as a board game for the general public.

Game about moving pawns through a locker until you reach the end of the course or fall eliminated. Slightly based on the Game of the Goose.
The route has bifurcations, and each square has different effects: the highlighted "La Chárcel", which obligates the player to answer a question or to do a try-out the first time or stop playing; "El Chobstáculo", like the previous one but with two opportunities; "El Saltichollo", with similar effect to the Goose; and "The Retrochollo", similar to the previous one, but backwards.

Se utilizó en un formato gigante en 1984 en el concurso de TV "Un, dos, tres... responda otra vez", para ser comercializado al poco tiempo como juego de mesa para el público general.

Juego de mover fichas por un casillero hasta llegar al final del recorrido o caer eliminado. Ligeramente basado en el Juego de la Oca. 
El recorrido tenía bifurcaciones, y cada casilla tenía efectos diferentes. Destacaban "La Chárcel", que obligaba a contestar una pregunta o hacer una prueba a la primera o dejar de jugar, "El Chobstáculo", igual que la anterior pero con dos oportunidades, "El Saltichollo", con efecto similar a la oca, y "El Retrochollo", similar a la anterior, pero hacia atrás.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Dwarf Team Card Pack
Description:
This is a pack of 45 handy reference cards for a Dwarf Blood Bowl team, along with blank cards allowing every coach to create their own players! Contained in the pack:


     Reference cards for Blockers, Runners, Blitzers, Troll Slayers, and Deathrollers;
     Reference cards for the following Star Players: Barik Farblast, Grim Ironjaw, Flint Churnblade, Boomer, Grombrindal The White Dwarf, and Morg 'N' Thorg;
     The following blank cards that you can use to create your own players: 13 Blockers, 3 Runners, 3 Blitzers, 3 Troll Slayers, and 2 Deathrollers;
     A team roster card, with match record on the reverse;
     4 Dirty Tricks cards: A Dwarf Wrote This Game You Know, Axe? What Axe?, Sports Almanac of Grudges, Undermining;
     4 Magical Memorabilia cards: Grimnir's Gromril Boots, Oath Stone of the High Coach, Rune-forged Catcher's Mitt, Guild of Engineers Experimental Helm of Flight;
     The most important card: a card explaining how to use the other cards.


—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Dark Elf Team Card Pack
Description:
This is a pack of 44 handy reference cards for a Dark Elf Blood Bowl team, along with blank cards allowing every coach to create their own players! Contained in the pack:


     Reference cards for Linemen, Runners, Blitzers, Assassins and Witch Elves;
     Reference cards for the following Star Players: Asperon Thorn, Mordrix Hex, Eldril Sidewinder, Elijah Doom, Horkon Heartripper, Hubris Rakarth, Kiroth Krakeneye, Roxanna Darknail, and Morg 'n' Thorg; 
     A special Golden Era Star Player card for using the legendary Jeremiah Kool in your games;
     The following blank cards that you can use to create your own players: 7 Linemen, 3 Runners, 3 Assassins, 5 Blitzers, 3 Witch Elves;
     A team roster card, with match record on the reverse;
     3 Benefits of Training cards: Boot Camp, Having a Nightmare, Lock-step;
     3 Dirty Tricks cards: Sideline Interference, Press Manipulation, Flash Bang;
     The most important card: a card explaining how to use the other cards.


—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer 40,000: Shield of Baal – Exterminatus
Description:
The 3rd release in the Shield of Baal campaign. Exterminatus is a two-book set containing:

The 152-page campaign book includes:
– The story of the final acts of war in the Cryptus System featuring the combined forces of the Blood Angels, Adepta Sororitas, Astra Militarum, and the Flesh Tearers versus the Tyranids of Hive Fleet Leviathan
– An explanation of how the Necrons of Cryptus awoke to lend their aid to the beleaguered world along with the fleet of Anrakyr the Traveller
– Example armies that took part in the climax of the campaign
– Background of the heroes and famous regiments of the campaign
– Stunning new artwork that brings the background to life and illustrates the regions of space around Cryptus

The 64-page rulebook includes:
– 8 new missions based on the events of the narrative book.
– 8 new datasheets for the Blood Angels 1st and 2nd Companies, Flesh Tearers, and the Necrons of the Mephrit Dynasty. That’s the equivalent of four Codex Supplements in one book!
– New warlord traits, relics and force organization charts for all four armies

Name: Cunning
Description:
A trick-taking game in where the goal is to play the lowest card of the trick face down to win points equal to the value of all cards in play.

The game ends after someone reaches the point limit of 50 times number of players or 20 turns, whichever is achieved first.

Name: School Fair Cafe Club!
Description:
Senior members have quit the after-school club because of their upcoming graduation, so you are left in the club alone. You must get more members to get over the crisis of abolition of your club, and there's one big chance: The School Festival! To publicize your club, you have decided to open a cafe in the festival. You gather members to help your cafe and your club, while earning money for your club by serving drinks and snacks. If you build a high reputation throughout the festival, your club will be allowed to continue!

ã‚¬ã‚¯ã‚µã‚¤ã‚­ãƒƒã‚µãƒ–! (Gakusai Kissabu!), a.k.a. School Fair Cafe Club!, is a worker-placement board game with a theme of business simulation, and the player with the highest reputation wins the game.

During the four-day festival, you manage your cafe to earn money and build reputation. A day is split into two phases: activity phase and trade phase. During the activity phase, your members invite another member to help you gain products and raise your publicity. You need products to sell for money, but you also need publicity which is counted as number of trades allowed in the trade phase.

During the trade phase, you sell your products for money and buy equipment for effects or reputation. A player with highest publicity makes a trade first, and may even make multiple trades in a row if that player's publicity is far ahead of anyone else. There is limited demand for products, so players with low publicity might miss chances to sell.

All ten members have their own special abilities which improve their activities and trades. However, members sometimes belong to two players at a time, in which case only one player may use that member. Player order is important in various ways.

Name: Battle of Ebro 1938: Spanish Civil War
Description:
Game covers the battle of Ebro, the longest and largest battle of the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939). It was fought between July and November 1938, with fighting mainly concentrated in two areas on the lower course of the Ebro River, the Terra Alta comarca of Catalonia, and the Auts area close to Fayón in the lower Matarranya, Eastern Lower Aragon. The results of the battle were disastrous for the Republican forces, with tens of thousands of dead and wounded and little effect on the advance of the Nationalists.

Game uses brigade-battalion scale. One of the most important aspects of the game is to keep as many bridges on ebro as possible, since it's the only way for tanks, artiller and supply to cross the river. Nationalists may use their air forces to destroy the bridges, slowing the Republican advance down.
Families: Series: Wielkie Bitwy 1939-45 (Dragon / Taktyka i Strategia)

Name: Room 25: VIP – Raptor Promo Tile
Description:
A bonus tile for Room 25 : VIP. With this tile you can use the Raptor miniature included in the boardgame "RAPTOR". Or you can use just a pawn if you didn't own this game.

Rules:
Place a Raptor in this room when revealed.
Each time a character enters a room (player or robot) occupied by the raptor immediately applies this effects:
• If the new arrival is from a blue or red room the raptor stay in the room and eliminate him.
• If the new arrival is from a green or yellow room the raptor escape into the room he come from and eliminate all character in it.

Name: Splendor: Jacques Cartier Promo Noble
Description:
Promotional Jacques Cartier noble tile offered exclusively through Tric Trac Shop

Requires 4 White and 4 Green to claim this noble for 3 points.

Works like any other noble and is just mixed into any game of Splendor that includes nobles. Cannot be used with the "Cities of Splendor" module in Cities of Splendor expansion

Name: Dark Side Of The Mine
Description:
Dark Side of the Mine takes place in the near future, where mining corporations compete to extract resources from nearby asteroids. Order your mining robots to secure the richest mineral deposits and score more points than your competition before the asteroid deck runs out.

In Dark Side of the Mine, a series of cards are laid out to represent the asteroid. A certain number of cards are placed face down (depending on the number of players), representing the area where players cannot send a communication signal to their robots -- the dark side. Each turn, players flip over the left-most face down card to reveal a new mineral deposit. They will then issue orders to their robots, draw a card, and, finally, place a card from their hand face down on top of the right-most face down card.  This represents the dark side moving as the players orbit the asteroid. Slower robots may get trapped on the dark side of the asteroid, lose contact with the company so they cannot receive orders, and must wait until the dark side passes by so communication can be restored.

On a player's turn, they have two out of four actions to perform:


     Prospect - play a card and order the mining robot to secure the next mineral deposit of that type moving clockwise;
     Upgrade - play a card and permanently increase the mining capabilities of the robots;
     Communicate - Move counter-clockwise around the asteroid until you find another robot and share information with them about the asteroid;  
     Recharge - Draw a new card into your hand.


Dark Side of the Mine is a deep strategy game in a small package.  Every card can be used for multiple purposes, whether to prospect the next mineral deposit, mine that deposit, upgrade your robots, or take advantage of the work other companies have done. Careful hand management and planning will ensure that you are the most successful mining corporation in the galaxy.

—description from the publisher
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: They Shall Not Pass: Bavarians at the Gates
Description:
This is the first of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 40 additional counters as well as scenarios and variants for several games:

Scenarios:

They Shall Not Pass: Bavarians at the Gates
They Shall Not Pass: Onlar Kacis Degil mi

Variants:

They Shall Not Pass: Zeppelins Over Verdun
Red Vengeance: Designer Variants
Red Vengeance: While Poles Yet Live
Alsace 1945: Air Pollution

—user summary
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Soldier Kings: Most Serene Empire
Description:
This is the third of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 28 additional counters with a page size color map with rules for variants of two games:

Soldier Kings: Most Serene Empire
Map and additional counters. Adds Venice as a major power to the games. Can replace Holland in a seven- or eight-player game or be played as a ninth power in a nine-player game.

Red Vengeance: The Curse of Turan
Adds units to enlarge and strengthen the Hungarian Armies. This serves to represent "what might have been".
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Second World War at Sea: Surcouf
Description:
This is the twelfth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 70 additional counters as well as variants for two games:

Counters:
The majority of the counters included are "long" rectangle pieces meant to replace ships in a number of other games that were originally represented by "small" square counters.  Pieces are replaced in the following games: Strike South, Eastern Fleet, Midway, Bismarck, Bomb Alley, and Leyte Gulf.

Variants:
Second World War at Sea: Bismarck - Adds rules for using the included Surcouf French submarine in several of these scenarios.

Great War at Sea: U.S. Navy Plan Gold - Adds rules for using the included Surcouf French submarine in several of these scenarios.

The countersheet included was originally printed for the Gold Club in 2007.

—user summary
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Great War at Sea: Great War of the Worlds at Sea
Description:
This is the ninth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 77 additional counters as well as scenarios and variants for several games:

Scenario:
Great War at Sea: Jutland - Variant is based on a battle described in Chapter 17 of H.G. Wells's novel War of the Worlds. Counters are provided for 3 martian tripods.

Variants:
Panzer Grenadier: Desert Rats -- Fascist Tanks: Adds the tanks Italy might have had

Soldier Kings: Polish Soldier Kings - Adds Poland as a ninth major power.

Soldier Kings: The Republic of Genoa - Adds Genoa to Soldier Kings. There is a downloadable map that must be downloaded, though the pieces are included here.

Soldier Kings: The Kingdom of Naples - Adds Naples to Soldier Kings as a minor Spanish ally.

Soldier Kings: Toothless Lion of the North - Rules for using Swedish galley fleets.

Soldier Kings: The Soldier Popes - Adds rules for including the papal army on the liberation of the Papal States.

—user summary
Families: Books: The War of the Worlds
Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Second World War at Sea: Gin Palace
Description:
This is the seventeenth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 25 additional counters as well as rules for their use in multiple Second World War at Sea games.

The premise is that the British hoped to sell the battleship Agincourt after World War I. These pieces are various possible roles for which the ship could have been repurposed. These range from an Armored Oiler to a Helicopter Carrier or even an Aircraft Carrier. Pieces are provided in colors of multiple nationalities with suggestions for use in various Second World War at Sea games.

—user summary
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Golden Journal Winter 2012: Assorted naval variants
Description:
This is the second of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 20 additional counters for ships in various Great War at Sea and Second World War at Sea
—user summary


     Japanese Repair Ship Akashi. On a “long” counter.
     Dutch fast battleships. Dutch naval constructors admired the Italian Littorio, when allowed to tour her, and tried hard to acquire her plans. While they initially intended to reap modern design ideas for their own battle cruisers, some hoped to use those plans to make their own. You can try out these powerful ships in Dutch colors in Spice Islands or Orange Waters.
     Austrian destroyers. The Tatra class on “long” counters.
     Lion Reborn. Lion and Princess Royal, as they might have been reconstructed in the 1930’s.
     Brandenburg Battleships. Revised pieces for the six-gun pre-dreadnoughts that served Germany and Turkey.
     Australia Reborn. Australia’s battle cruiser as she might have been rebuilt for the Second World War (or Second Great War).


—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)
Series: Second World War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Battles of 1866: Austrian Gatling Guns
Description:
This is the sixth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 21 additional counters with rules on their inclusion in two games.
—user summary

For Frontier Battles, we look at Austria's too-little-too-late attempts to arm its infantry with breechloading rifles, and how this might have affected the outcome of the battles of 1866 had it been accomplished in time. We've provided new pieces for a brigade armed with Werndl breechloaders (Ferdinand Poschacher von Poschach's "Iron Brigade" of I Corps) so you can try it out in the Jicin scenarios.

As part of Austria's desperate attempts to re-arm, the Imperial-Royal Army acquired another new technology: the Gatling gun. The Viennese firm of Paget purchased a license and began production, but the guns did not reach the troops until years after the war had ended. Once again, we have new pieces to equip I and X Corps so you can mow down the Prussians at Jicin and Trautenau.

We went the route of weirdness and fun for Chickamauga&Chattanooga. You get pieces for the Confederate helicopter, so you can bomb the Yankee invaders into oblivion. Or as the Northern forces of freedom, you can deploy Siamese elephants.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Wars of the States and Empires (Avalanche Press)

Name: Gazala 1942: Italian Armored Divisions
Description:
This is the nineteenth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 40 additional counters with rules and scenarios for their use in Gazala 1942.
—user summary

Our 19th issue brings several Italian-themed variants to our Gazala 1942 game, with additional Italian armored divisions added to the game (in place of those deadly German panzer divisions).

There’s the 133rd “Littorio” Armored Division, which had just arrived and spent the battle acclimatizing its troops and vehicles to the North African desert but could have been brought to the front. The 131st “Centauro” Armored Division, which did not deploy to North Africa until after the campaign had already been lost. And the 134th “Freccia” Armored Division, which began forming but never saw action. Plus some other units that might have been present, allowing you to fight the Battle of Gazala without the Germans (spoiler: Gazala without the Germans is pretty tough for the Axis).
—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Panzer Grenadier (Modern): 1967 – Sword of Israel: Soviet Airborne
Description:
This is the twenty-second of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 24 additional counters as well as additional scenarios.

[Includes] a battalion of Soviet paratroopers to battle the Israelis in the threatened but never executed intervention into the Six Day War.

The Soviet Army's 103rd Guards Airborne Division is a well-trained and well-armed outfit, in the midst of preparations for the Dnepr 1967 exercises - a complete contrast to the Arab armies the Israelis face in the standard scenarios in 1967: Sword of Israel.

The Soviet parachute battalion of 1967 is very much a light infantry outfit - air-droppable armored carriers would only start to arrive the next year, converting the airborne formations into far more capable all-arms units. To make up for that lack, the battalion wields a large number of support weapons: Sagger anti-tank missiles, heavy mortars, recoilless rifles and the diminuitive ASU-85 assault gun.

From the Publisher
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Leipzig
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Potsdam
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Das München-Spiel
Description:
This game is a memory-variant with pictures of the city or region the game is developed for. There are many different editions for about 200 cities or regions in Germany.

Each pair of tiles has a set of corresponding questions on it, where each tiles also gives the answer to the other one.
This way, several trivia-games can be played. Two special dice are included.

The rules describe 7 different way of plays.

Name: Shinobi Empire
Description:
In Shinobi Empire, you are trying to lead your ninjas to infiltrate the castle quicker than all the other players.  Infiltration is not enough though, you must get your ninjas to the room where intelligence are gathered.

You do not know the internals of the castle at the beginning of the game but as the game progresses, the castle will slowly reveal itself.  This is accomplished by players playing cards to introduce hallways, ninjas and walls to each floor.  Players are trying to make the biggest room possible with the presence of their ninjas by capping a hallway with walls.  Only the single biggest room will count though:  Open ended hallways and rooms tied in size do not qualify.

The first player to successfully places 7 ninjas of his clan in the largest rooms in the castle wins!

Name: Mord im Büro
Description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Murder in the Office

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Name: Von Noten und Toten
Description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: About music and death

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Name: Mein allererstes Würfelspiel
Description:
My very first dice game

The mouse, cat, bear and elephant try to reach their cosy bed in the clouds as fast as possible. But only the one who has a bit of luck with the dice and who takes big steps will arrive there first.

A very first dice game with simple rules, wooden child-friendly counters and a big dice with symbols.

Game material: 4 mice, 4 cats, 4 elephants, 4 bears, 1 game board, 1 large dice with symbols

Name: Prinzessin Amelia
Description:
Princess Amelia

This is a game for glittering princesses, both big and small!

It's almost time for the annual summer festival in honour of the great fairy sorceress Valpurga and you are invited, of course. So, you go into the big diamond forst to look for the most beautiful, glittering stones so that you can light up the magical festival with your jewellery. 
The princess with the prettiest jewellery wins the game and is queen for the evening.

Name: Trading Races
Description:
A party game for Black culture. Can you Out-Black folks?

Gameplay:
To start the game, each player draws 5 cards. One randomly chosen player begins and plays a card. Everyone else selects a card from their hand that reflects a higher level of blackness and places their card down.

Each player then defends their card selection in relationship to the other players card. As a group, players must come to a consensus on which card is blacker.

Whoever played the winning card keeps the hand and wins the book. The winning player starts the next hand and everyone draws back up to 5 cards.

The player with the most books wins the game.

from publisher's website

Name: Das geheimnisvolle Amulett
Description:
House of Anubis: The Mysterious Amulet

The mysterious amulet is broken, parts are lost! 
You put yourself in the shoes of one of the Anubis characters and search for the various amulet parts. Be carefull, since the way is dangerous and the other players try to take away the parts of the amulet. Only, if you manage to reach the target, you are safe so that you can combine the parts of the amulet.

Name: Lizenz zum Sterben
Description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Licence to Die

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

Name: Das Haus Anubis: Pfad der 7 Sünden
Description:
House of Anubis: Path of Seven Sins

While the Anubis friends are searching for Nina, they are lost in a mysterious phantasy world.A An enchanted path meanders through this world, the path of seven sins. The Anubis frinds are following this path to eventually find Nina. But dangers lurk everywhere!
The players need to pass several tests in order to resist the sins.

Name: Der Schatz von Anubis
Description:
Treasure of Anubis

Does the treasure of Anubis actually exist?
The players put themselves in the shoes of the Anubis characters and move their pawns from one mysterious room to the other in the boarding school and the antiquity shop.

Name: Kommissar Rex: Das Verkehrsspiel für Spürnasen
Description:
Material:
Gameboard 28 places (city) for the question cards
          (all have a colored border).
          26 fields around the board for the moving
             of Kommissar Rex
36 Question cards Front with a road sign on the front side
        (all have a colored border),
         name of the sign and meaning of the sign.
              on the back side
1 dice: Numbers 2 + 3 and Paw Symbol (each 2 times)
1 dice: with the direction Road Signs "turn right", "turn left",
        "straightforward"

Setup:
On every city field 1 question card (road signs)is placed (colors are ignored). These are the fields where the player can move their stones. The rest of the cards, are not needed for the actual  game.

Target:
The player with the most question cards at the end of the game wins.

At players turn he roles both die and moves his stone exactly the number he has rolled. He has to change the direction (left or right) 1 time if he has a turn left or turn right.
If on the target field there is still a question card, the player gets it without any question.
If the field is already empty, he looks at the colored boarder of the field and can try to steal a card with the same color from another player. To do this he has to say the right name of the sign (for experst: He has to say additional what is the meaning of the sign, for little children: they get it for free). 
   
Kommissar Rex the Dog from the TV crime series is moving on the fields at the edges around the board every time the paw symbol is diced (the actual player gets no card).
The game ends when Kommissar Rex reaches the police station.

Cooperativ variant
In this variant the stones are allowed to be movesd on the fields at the edge of the board, when they hit exactly Kommissar Rex. All players are allowed to move every stone. All players win if they have done this with all 4 stones before Kommissar Rex reaches the police station. If a stone does not reach Kommissar Rex but a Question Card, the player is asked for the name of the road sign on it. If it's the right name he gets the 
card and Kommissar Rex is moving 1 field. Otherwise ths card and Kommissar Rex stay on their places.

Name: Monstermampf
Description:
A game for all those who loves monsters!

Who hasn't been of a loud, growling monster? But monsters don't growl, because they are angry, but because they are very hungry. The hungry monster's stomach growls so loudly that it sometimes frightens itself. Help the monsters by feeding them. Find the right treat and free the monster from its growling stomach. The winner is the player who has succesfully fed the most monsters at the end of the game.

Name: Gummibären im Zauberwald
Description:
Jelly babies in the mysterious forest

The jelly babies explored the mysterious forest and found the following magic objects: Magic swords, secret maps, magic rings and bags of gold. 
Each player tries to move the pawns on the board so that they eventually arrive in his house and give him some magic presents. The first player with all 4 kinds of magic objects wins the game!

But beware of the wizard who changes the magic objects into useless flowers!

Name: Nuclear Bro-liferation
Description:
Nuclear Bro-liferation is a cooperative and competitive card game for 1-4 players. Players take the roles of Jon Johnson and his Special Operation Bros as they battle invading alien monsters. Along the way, players will face terrible social and political mishaps, friendly fire, and special boss monsters. Each game wave lasts 20-30 minutes, with up to four waves of increased difficulty. The competitive mode offers a cutthroat wave of resource grabbing, trophy hoarding, and backstabbing.

At the start of a players turn they will draw a card off the Battle Deck and either place the monster in the Battle Zone or resolve a political mishap. Next they can take one action to attack a monster, buy a item, heal, etc. After their action the player will draw one card from the Grunt Support deck to either aid or hinder the player on their turn. And finally, the monsters attack the player, causing 1 point of damage for every 4 strength. Then play moves to the next Bro.

The game continues until all monsters in the Battle Zone and Battle Deck are defeated. The players loose if all Bros die. If a Bro dies, you aren't out of the game yet! You can continue as a Bhrost and aid your team from the afterlife by drawing from the Battle Deck as normal and drawing 2 Grunt Support cards and choosing the better of the 2.

Competitive mode plays the same, however Bros will total up their kills at the end of the game, applying various modifiers.

The game can also be played solo! The player simply controls all 4 Bros at once, taking their turns one after another.

—description from the publisher

Name: Geometrie für Kinder
Description: Geometry for children

Name: Helltoken: Remote Control Robot (ヘルトウクン)
Description:
Publishers summary
ãƒ˜ãƒ«ãƒˆã‚¦ã‚¯ãƒ³ (Herutoukun) HELLTOKEN: REMOTE CONTROL ROBOT is a Japanese game with two secret societies both operating the same giant robot by remote control. The giant robot has been built by Dr Mad, who sells it for 100m Bitcoin. The two buyers are evil organizations aiming for world conquest,
é­”è¡“çµç¤¾ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒ¨ (Magical Association Memorireo) and ãƒžã‚¹ãƒ‰ãƒ¬ãƒ€ãƒ¼ç§‘å­¦è²¡å›£ (Masudoreda Science Foundation). Since he only built one robot, Dr Mad lets the two groups fight for it, using the robot.

In Helltoken, all players control the same robot. You either try to crush the opponent's base, or deduce where your own hidden base is.

The game is easily to play by all, even those who have a hard time deducing! And the art is done by Takashi Kurihara, of 'Katamari Damacy' fame!

Name: Kreuz und Quer durch das Neue Testament
Description:
This game is a mixturure of a Bible trivia Game and Monopoly.
The board game has 2 parts: In the middle a card of Mediterranean Sea at the period of Jesus. There is a single path through this map.
The second part of the board are fields at the border of the board with fields known from Monopoly. Instead of streets this are chapters from the New Testament. There are some special fields where you have to ask questions from the bible.

The game starts at the start point of the map track. The actual player roles 2 die and moves. dependent of the points on the die he gets questions from different stacks of cards (all from the bible). If he knows the answer he gets the points written on the card.    
When the track ends the figure changes to the Monopoly kind path. Like in Monopoly you can by the fields, but not with money but with the points you have collected with the right answered questions. You have to pay parking fee for fields owned by other players. As in Monopoly you can increase the parking fee by placing houses (they are named red and white stones here.
Running out of points and area cards you may change back to the Mediterranean Sea path 1 time to get points answering new questions.
The game ends after a predefined time. The player with the most points wins (including value of area cards and stones).

Variants (mentioned in rules):
1. Just role the die and run first the Mediterranean Sea path and after that the Monopoly path. The first player who comes to the Start of teh Monopoly Path again.  
2. Bible trivia: Just use the question cards. Who has the most points at a predefined time wins the game.

Name: Mega Party
Description:
Collection of party games for youngsters:
- Quiz about music, charts and stars
- Live acts and pantomimes
- Quiz about trend sports, such as mountain biking, inline skating, skate boarding, etc.
- Describing words while avoiding any forbidden terms
- Blindfolded drawing
- Spinning the bottle

Name: Off World: Building Better Colonies
Description:
In Off World you control one of the leading international corporations that have carved out the dying, polluted Mother Earth, sucked dry of natural resources. Following a major technological breakthrough that allowed interstellar travel lasting dozens of years at a time, these companies have invested massive sums into private space fleets that would launch an immediate exploration effort across the neighboring systems. Your success is measured not only in hard cash but chiefly in your colony assets, among them terraforming installations on inhospitable planets. 
In a 3X type of play (explore, exploit, expand), there is little place for the fourth X - exterminate. Always keep in mind that corporate boards are stationed back in the Solar System and answer before authorities for every wrongdoing, forcing them to play within the rules enforced by the United Nations.

Name: Code Red! Warfare in the 21st Century
Description:
CODE RED! is a card game that pits players in a grand contest of global competition and conflict.  With the boxed set of Code RED! players assume the mantle of the United States or the People's Republic of China.  Where conflict erupts is determined by which Theatres a player puts into play during their turn, from Washington to Beijing and everything in between.

Players initially construct their deck.  Paying attention to how many Theatre cards they include, tempering this against the number units and force multipliers they need in order to get the job done.  If your deck is too small you can't effectively carry out your plans or respond to threats.  Too big and you find that F-22 Raptor or Nimitz Carrier just never seems to be drawn.

Make sure your force mix can operate effectively within the Theatre you want to dominate.  Be wary, include forces that can defend your home territories too.

Aside from decks, players begin the game with an allocation of Command and Control tokens.  Command tokens let you do things in game, from drawing additional cards, withdrawing revealed units to activating force multipliers.  Running out of Command tokens can see your grand strategy grind to a halt or your ability to counter your opponents actions (like being able to intercept that ICBM!).

Control tokens are your life blood, the ability to gain Control tokens at the expense of your opponent is crucial to winning Code Red!  Run out of Control tokens at the end of your turn you lose the game.

Gameplay is handled with a three step turn sequence which alternates between players.

Resupply - Draw cards and possibly Command tokens if you're contesting Theatres.

Reorganistation - Deploy Theatres, deploy and reorganise your units and force multipliers within Theatres.  Pay attention when assigning forces to Theatres you wish to defend as well as those you wish to attack.

Operations - The business end of the turn, players activate units and force multipliers in a Theatre by declaring a Code Alert for each Theatre they contest.

Code Blue - do nothing
  Code Green - Use your units to detect the enemies hidden forces
  Code Yellow - Through a show of military power, force the enemy to withdraw from a Theatre, ceding control to you.
  Code Red - War becomes hot!  Attack and destroy all enemy units within a Theatre, obliterate them to win control.
  
Remember, if you are reduced to zero Control tokens at the end of your turn you lose the game.

The game is expandable, we've just added 54 card expansions for both China and the United States.  With plans to include decks representing Russia, Iran, Syria, North Korea and Israel in the  future.

—description from the publisher

Name: Über den Atlantik
Description:
This is a race between airships, aeroplanes and ships from Berlin to New York and vice versa. The red party starts in New York, the blue in Berlin. Movement is controlled by drawing small tiles. The tiles show a blue or red airship, plane or ship. The player owning the pictured vessel places the tile in front of his vessel, covering 2 spaces and moves the vessel to the front of the tile, thereby determining a travel route over the Atlantic Ocean. There are also special tiles, labeld "Nebel" (fog), "Gewitter" (thunderstorm) and "Sturm" (storm) wich are used to block the opponents movement.

The first pary or player to reach his destination with all his vessels wins the game.

Name: CoreBall: The Zero Gravity Sport
Description:
CoreBall: The Zero Gravity Sport is a tactical sports game in space that pitches 2-4 players in brutal matches to control one or more balls while avoiding incoming asteroids and space debris.

The aim of the game is to score more points than your opponents during the course of four rounds by maintaining control of the ball and keeping your team hale and on the board. To do so, players must carefully pick a team of flyers, or highly skilled space suit-clad athletes, to steal the ball, grapple their opponents, push them out of the field or against the hazardous terrain and obstacles of a CoreBall circuit, or simply hack their opponent's space suits so they can't move.

Each flyer has unique skills and through careful planning and positioning, players can trigger combinations to outsmart their opponents and survive the ever-changing board.

Name: Boxitale: Elite Explorers
Description:
An innovative tabletop game that uses a smartphone/ tablet to stream an animated series taking place in a galactic universe.

The game present challenges to the players, the challenges are solved using craft that is placed on the board game

Craft game!

the game is build of episodes and the players win by completing an episode

Captain Kadara has a secret mission of investigating the existence of an unknown space station found on an asteroid near Venus. He assembles a team that includes: Lumi, an “I can fix all” technician, a professor and the kids (in the game, they are called guardians).
Together, they discover the truth about the space station and they need to face the upcoming challenges that come with this new knowledge.
The kids use various crafted technics and a lot of imagination and creativity to solve the challenges and save “El Animal.”

Name: Teruel: Turning point of the Spanish Civil War
Description:
"Winter of 1937. Madrid, the republican capital, is threatened by an imminent nationalist attack. To recover the initiative the Republican high command decides to launch a strong offensive to occupy the city of Teruel. Among heavy snow, 30,000 Republican soldiers march from their positions; the battle that will decide the fate of the war begins."

Teruel is tactical level game depicting the two months of hard fighting over Teruel.

The game includes 216 counters representing Battalion and Brigade sized units and command units up to Corp level of the Republican ("Levante")and Nationalist ("Norte") armies in the area of Teruel. The counters are in the style of Spanish Civil War military symbols representing cavalry, infantry, armor, artillery, etc. Five separate scenarios are presented, including a solo scenario (Plan T).

Name: RAMPopoly
Description:
A high-flying aviation game of elimination starring Lloyd L. Lander. Fly your miniature plane around the airport themed board winning as many Airline, Airport and Service Contracts as possible.
The more aviation Contracts you operate, the more money you'll make!

Rolling the red & green dice (dice double as auction & repairs) to fly your coloured plane to purchase Airline service contracts to earn money from the loading/unloading of baggage & cargo. Additional income can also be earned from providing aircraft power and fuel services. Should a player have twin contracts eg. both Scottish airlines then more baggage capacity can be added to collect higher contract fees.

The unique auction & repairs mechanic sees both dice rolled, should the green die roll higher than the red die then the player receives the “green” light to repair their plane or have won a contract aution.

Win a Long Haul game by being the last airport services company operating on the ramp. A Short Haul game is won after the first player has been bankrupted, the player with the most assests wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Knot Tying Game: Camper's Challenge
Description:
Challenge your rival.
Learn & Master 52 Knots, win points!
Unique Knot Tying Card Deck ranges in difficulty from Beginner to Advanced.
Play it as a game for 2 or more players, or brush up on your Knot Tying skills.
Each player selects one length of tying rope and one tying bar. From a deck of cards, one card is turned face up and players race to be the first to tie the Knot. The first player is given the knot tying card with its point value. Cards are played, one by one, until all the cards are used. The winner is the player with the highest sum of points.

Name: Lynx
Description:
Be the first to find all your pictures on the board, collect the most cards and win!

The boardgame (made of several moving pieces, for replayability) depicts various every-day objects.

At the beggining of esch turn, players are dealt with three facedown cards. Each card depicts an object. Simultanously, all players look at their cards and try to spot the same object on the board, claiming each find. When one of them finds all three, scoring begins: that player collects his three cards, while the other players collect the number of cards each was able to find. Turns continue like this until one player collects (finds) 25 objects.

Name: Diesel Punk Apocalypse
Description:
Out in the wastes, our engines roar. Rumor of a city full of scrap and supplies lay out there on the red horizon. Getting there first is the problem.

Diesel Punk Apocalypse is a fast-paced game of vehicular mayhem. Players take the wheel of a unique faction as they battle across scrolling road tiles. When a vehicle is destroyed, the fun doesn't end. Just draw another vehicle blueprint, punch the nitro, and reenter the fray!

The faction of marauders with the most points at the end of the game wins!

Name: Expansion or Extinction
Description:
Expansion or Extinction takes 2 to 4 players into a future where Sol, after colonizing many of the closest stars, succumbed to internal pressures and died in a fiery holocaust of future weaponry.  Now earth’s colonies are recovering, and beginning to exert their own dominance on the stars around them. Based on the award-winning  Triumph and Tragedy  game system, Expansion or Extinction expands upon this proven and highly popular game system.

Expansion or Extinction begins as each of the player’s star systems have rediscovered the technologies which make space travel possible again.  Players must explore the systems around them, and attempt to bring them into their sphere of influence.  This can occur either peaceably through the play of Action Cards, or through military conquest.

There are three types of star systems in Expansion or Extinction.  Those closest to SOL: the Core Worlds. These worlds have been settled the longest, and thus tend to have the highest population, but have consumed most of their resources.  Those furthest out: the Outer Rim worlds, which were settled just before SOL’s fall.  These tend to have low population but high resources.  And between those extremes are the Green Worlds…where the players start, here there is a good balance of population and resources.  But beware, these worlds are on the cusp of challenging for dominance on their own, and have the fleets to make their conquest a hard fought struggle!

—description from the publisher

Name: Treasure Hunters Expansions
Description:
Treasure Hunters Expansions is a pack of three expansions that work with all games in the "Treasure Hunters" line: Scuttle!, Ninjitsu!, Brains!, and all upcoming titles in the series. The expansions are:


     Masters of Magic: An ancient grimoire has been uncovered, unleashing the secrets of elemental magic!



     The Elements: Each player chooses a unique ability to play with in the game. Harness the power of Earth, Fire, Wind, Water, or Heart!



     Heavy Weather: Shuffle the event cards into the deck, and reveal a new weather card each time one reaches the top!

Name: The Fantasy Trip: Legacy Edition
Description:
The Fantasy Trip: Legacy Edition box set includes:


     Updated versions of the mini-games Melee and Wizard
     The books In The Labyrinth, Advanced Melee, and Advanced Wizard, combined and updated into a single volume of 176 pages, with the index that the original release lacked.
     The classic dungeon-crawl adventure Tollenkar's Lair with a full-color labyrinth map.
     Death Test, the solo adventure.
     Death Test 2, a second solo adventure.
     Six sheets of die-cut megahexes.
     A pad of 2.5" x 3.5" character sheets for use with Melee.
     A pad of 5" x 3.5" character sheets for use with Wizard.
     A booklet of character/reference sheets
     A four-panel, landscape format GM screen
     17” × 22” full-color regional map.
     17” × 22” full-color village map.


See also the RPGGeek entry for this item: The Fantasy Trip: Legacy Edition
Families: Series: The Fantasy Trip (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: War Júnior
Description:
Borders have been broken! You have now in your hands powerful missiles capable of decimating entire armies in a few seconds. Simpler rules that value strategy and make attacks and defenses much more exciting. Command your armies, conquering territories and dominating the world! Challenge your friends and feel the adrenaline of a real war!

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Romperam-se todas as fronteiras! Agora você tem em suas mãos poderosos mísseis capazes de dizimar exércitos inteiros em poucos segundos. Regras mais simples valoziram a estratégia e tornam os ataques e defesas muito mais emocionantes. Comande você também os seus exércitos, conquistando territórios e dominando o mundo! Desafie seus amigos e sinta toda a adrenalina de una guerra de verdade!

—description from the back of the box (Portuguese)
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Ultimate Spider-man
Description:
You are different characters from the Spider-man universe that compete to be first to beat Green Goblin, Doctor Octopus and The Lizzard.

The game is a simple roll and move game. You move the exact steps that the die shows and do what the spot you land on shows. Some spots you do nothing, on other you collect webb-tiles, on other you use the web-tiles that you have collected and then try to swing up to a roof-top where you try to win over one of the super-villians and last there are spot that you can get to a roof-top without webb-tiles.

The first player that have collected three different villians-tiles is the winner.

Name: Panzer Grenadier: Sherman Tanks
Description:
This is the twenty-third of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 24 additional counters, all alternative Sherman Tanks, with variants for their use.
—user summary

Almost 50,000 Shermans would be produced during the Second World War, equipping not only U.S. Army and Marine Corps tank units but those of many Allied nations as well. The Sherman appears in many Panzer Grenadier games (more of them than you’d think, thanks to all of those Allied Shermans).

But are those Shermans studly enough? Designer Brian Knipple gave them an armor rating of “3” in Battle of the Bulge, the first game in which they appeared. They remained so rated in Desert Rats, their next appearance (this time in British colors) and it’s been that way ever since. Should they have had armor of “4”? Some fans thought so from the beginning, but we have stuck with “3.”

Our “Belton’s Bane” variant gives you two dozen Sherman tank platoons of various types (M4 Shermans, M4/76 and M4/105) and service (Army, Marines). While the Sherman had a bewildering number of sub-types, most of the differences aren’t enough to show up in game terms and we’ve always kept the naming conventions simple.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Fire in the Steppe: Battles in Ukraine, 1941 – Land Battleships
Description:
This is the twenty-fifth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 24 additional counters as well as scenarios that use them.
—user summary

There are four new tanks presented in the set of pieces, all of them proposed to the Red Army in the late 1930’s for the “breakthrough” role: the T35B, with a modified engine and armor, the T35C, with heavier guns (95mm main gun and 57mm anti-tank guns), the heavy T28C with a 95mm gun, and the SMK two-turreted heavy tank.
—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements

Name: Great War at Sea: Cruiser Warfare – Armored Cruisers
Description:
This is the twenty-sixth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 20 additional counters for use with Great War at Sea: Cruiser Warfare as well as scenarios and variants for their use.
—user summary

We have the armored cruiser Blücher as re-designed with 11-inch (280mm) guns in place of her actual outfit of 8.2-inch (210mm) pieces. And additional armored cruisers that never existed, for use in Cruiser Warfare, replacement pieces for armored cruisers that had their armament adjusted in the Final Edition of Cruiser Warfare, and finally some ships that appeared in the game on “small” pieces now have the full glory of a “long” piece, like the Canadian cruiser Rainbow or Japanese seaplane carrier Wakamiya.
—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Avalanche Press Gold Club Golden Journal Supplements
Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: CATAiN: The Most Longest Unco
Description:
CATAiN is a Japanese parody of Settlers of Catan.  The goal is simple. Only you can create the world's longest poop (unco)!

Roll dice to collect food resources (Meat, Vegetable, Fruit, Potato, and Milk) and use those to deposit poop logs on the intestinal wall tiles.  Single poops, double poops, thick poops!  The world is your poop oyster!

After a modular number of defecations (excretion timing in Japanese parlance), a winner will be decided by the longest deuce passed during the game.

Use action cards, enemas (GANCHO!), and laxatives to alter the board and pace of the game.

As Crap Games so eloquently said during the game's debut, "Aim for the Asshole!"  Can you make the World's Longest Poop!?

—description from the Publisher

Name: Marbel Firefighter: The Card Game
Description:
Oops! The flame fo fire burns the Marbel Town! Hurry! Get Ready to extinguish the fire before it's too late!

Be the best firefighter in Marbel Town! Grab the hose, plug it in to hydrant, shoot the water and extinguish the fire! Earn the points as much as possible. Get the extra points by rescuing other victims such as cat, baby and grandma.

Player with the highest points will be the champion of the game. What are you waiting for? Let's play this fun game!

				
				
					HOW TO PLAYIn the player turn, they have up to 2 action and choose one of this action : 
1. Extinguish The Fire
We can extinguish the fire with discard our cards in hand same with the symbols showing on the fire card. We can use star cards as a wild card. All player can only extinguish fire that stay on same position with hydrant card.

2. Move the Hydrant
We can discard 1 extinguish card with the specific symbol to move hydrant card into the different building. Symbol at the discarded card must same with building symbol.

3. Exchange Card 
We can exchange 1 card in hand with 1 card in 4 opened extinguish cards.

After one player turn we must check : 
1. If total cards in hand less than 5, player must take new cards form pile so player get total 5 cards in hands.

2. If all of 4 opened extinguish cards is have same symbol. Discard all and open new 4 cards from pile.

3. If pile is runout, we can re-shuffle discarded cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Bushido: Minimoto Clan Starter Set
Description:
The Minimoto clan are as stoic and unyielding as the Iron Mountains they call home. Unparalleled masters of metal craft and the arts of metallurgy and mining. The great mountain not only provides the clan’s wealth but also its protection. This great clan, whose loyalty was once unquestioned by the Takashis, has grown distant of late. Rumours spread of the Old Bear rousing from too many long winters, slumbering in his mountain halls, and he is hungry. So long on the fringes of the ‘civilised’ world have left the Bear clan without the need or taste for the frivolities of court, ‘The Bear does not dance’, but it does fight, and would that be against the shadows, Dragon, Eagle or Snake it pays no mind, for with Tetsubo in hand there are few that can oppose its fury.

Blister contains five models, five 30mm bases, five full colour profile cards, one enhancement card and one theme card.

Name: Bushido: Jyoto Ashigaru
Description:
All Jyoto Ashigaru are heavily armoured, each suit individually tailored to the particular soldier. They carry heavy metal Tetsubo which most men need two hands to use (Though some of the Minimoto effortlessly swing them with one hand or indeed, wield two of them!) with which they are trained relentlessly to build up their strength. They form the bulk of the Minimoto forces and each started their life in the army as an unblessed, proving themselves before joining the ranks of the Jyoto Ashigaru.

Blister contains two models, two 30mm bases and one full colour profile card.

Name: Bushido: Hisoka
Description:
Hisoka is undoubtedly and completely mad. He spends much time alone in the mountains and how he survives is a mystery, when he does venture to the lower climbs his bare chest makes even the hardiest of Minimoto shiver. He does however fight for what he believes in and his knowledge of the land and surviving the wilderness is very useful to the Minimoto, whilst his resilience and hardiness leaves the peasants of the Ro-Kan in awe.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.

Name: Aristeia!: Smoke and Mirrors
Description:
Smoke & Mirrors (SnM) Expansion reminds us that Aristeia! is pure spectacle, a Show for Maya where everything is crafted and treated for the audience’s consumption.

A Father-Inquisitor set to burn heretics, an Eastern Warlock that tortures his enemies with their worst nightmares, a bloodthirsty half-breed Wulver and a smoke throwing robot. Fantastic Characters that will rise the audience levels.

Murtair, Close combat fighter that can use Damage he’s suffered to his own benefit. Offensive profile, given that his Defense is low, and he has no easy way to Disengage (his bloodthirstiness keeps him from leaving the combat).

Kozmo, Support-scorer that protects her team by blocking Line of Sight with her Smoke. Even though she has a very good Defense, she is not a tank.

Padre Inquisidor Mendoza, The Automatic Skill Sanatur a Deo, couple with his Damage capabilities, turn him into an off-tank. If the rival Team has no appropriate counter, he can also work as a tank, because is hard to send him to the Infirmary.

Táowù, Control Support, very aggressive that works mainly with the enemy’s card pool. In addition to that, he is always threating to impose the Immobilized State very easily.

A new type of token that affects the Hexadome Spaces is added:

Smoke. Smoke affects Space visibility, blocking Line of Sight without hindering movement.

A new State is added:

Burning. While the blue side of a burning token is up, the player rolls an Orange Dice. For every success, The Character receives a 1 Damage, while for each Special the Character receives a new Burning token.

Smoke and Mirrors is not a full game. Need a copy of Aristeia! to play.

Name: Bushido: Minimoto Clan Special Card Pack
Description:
Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way will enable you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want. These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.

Pack contains fourteen faction specific special cards.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Dark Elf Pitch & Dugout Set
Description:
A double-sided card Blood Bowl pitch, complete with matching dug-outs, this is the perfect place for your Dark Elves teams to play. One side represents a pitch aboard a corsair vessel peacefully sailing the calm azure seas – the other side is a touch more fraught, as an enormous sea monster – a kraken, attracted by the roar of the crew – is dragging the vessel down, soaking the pitch with slippery brine and hampering plucky players with its questing tentacles. The dug-outs are themed to match, and feature score trackers, reserves, Knocked Out and Serious Injury boxes, Down trackers for both halves, and a re-roll tracker.

The pitch is made to the same specifications as the board included with the Blood Bowl boxed game, and includes rules for play with the bothersome aquatic pest trying to hinder your match.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Chaos Chosen Pitch & Dugout Set
Description:
A double-sided cardboard Blood Bowl pitch, complete with matching dug-outs, this is the perfect place for your Chaos Chosen teams to play. One side features a huge, imposing Chaos temple, given over rather to ruination with cracked stone and encroaching plant life – but once blood is spilled, the temple awakes, and the other side of the pitch come into play with sudden lava pits and baleful energies making your game a rather more fraught affair. The dug-outs are themed to match, and feature score trackers, reserves, Knocked Out and Serious Injury boxes, Down trackers for both halves, and a re-roll tracker.

The pitch is made to the same specifications as the board included with the Blood Bowl boxed game, and includes rules for play with the awakened Chaos temple.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): The Naggaroth Nightmares – Dark Elf Blood Bowl Team
Description:
A new team founded after the collapse of the NAF, many Nightmares players previously played for the disbanded Naggaroth Nightwings who fell into receivership when the head coach took flight with the team treasury. Despite their status as a new team then, they have an influx of incredible talent, and are already proving themselves to be nightmares (do you see?) for their opponents…

This multi-part plastic kit contains the components necessary to assemble the Naggaroth Nightmares, a Dark Elf Blood Bowl team. The team consists of 6 Linemen, 2 Blitzers, 2 Runners and 2 Witch Elves – each is clad in some pretty spikesome armour, with the hides of Cold Ones draped over their shoulders. The Witch Elves are ...slightly less armoured, and can be modelled either with hands pointing imperiously toward their opponents – or clutching a still-beating heart. The Linemen have 3 different designs of head.

There are a host of extras in the kit – 2 turn markers, 2 double-sided score coins featuring a Dark Elves icon and 4 balls – 2 kraken eggs (with protruding tentacles) and 2 balls made from the hide of a Cold One, lacking pegs.

Supplied with 12 32mm Blood Bowl bases, a 1,000,000 GP roster and a Dark Elf transfer sheet.

—description from the publisher

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Josef Bugman – Coach & Star Player
Description:
The name Josef Bugman is as synonymous with Blood Bowl as Goblins are with being cheating gits. Pitches bear the Bugman’s B, while the bearded face of the master brewer grins down on players from massive billboards. When Bugman turns up at a match in person it is a spectacle to behold.

Bugman is no mere spectator, however, as the stout brewer owns numerous teams, and coaches them from his private dugout as he knocks back beer after beer.
